intro: Teijsmanniodendron borneense, commonly known as the Bornean teijsmanniodendron, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse growth forms. The plant is characterized by its smooth, often reddish bark and lanceolate leaves with a glossy surface. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native region.
